sentences: Colson Baker (born April 22, 1990), known professionally as Machine Gun Kelly (MGK), is an American rapper, singer, musician, and actor.
section: N/A

sentences: He is noted for his compositional blending of contemporary and alternative hip hop with rock.
section: N/A

sentences: Machine Gun Kelly released four mixtapes between 2007 and 2010 before signing with Bad Boy Records.
section: N/A

sentences: He released his debut studio album, Lace Up, in 2012, which peaked at number four on the US Billboard 200 and contained his breakout single "Wild Boy" (featuring Waka Flocka Flame).
section: N/A

sentences: His second and third albums, General Admission (2015) and Bloom (2017), achieved similar commercial success; the latter included the single "Bad Things" (with Camila Cabello), which peaked at number 4 on the Billboard Hot 100.
section: N/A

sentences: His fourth album, Hotel Diablo (2019), included rap rock.
section: N/A

sentences: Machine Gun Kelly released his fifth album, Tickets to My Downfall, in 2020; it marked a complete departure from hip hop and entry into pop punk.
section: N/A

sentences: It debuted at number one on the Billboard 200, the only rock album to do so that year, and contained the single "My Ex's Best Friend", which reached number 20 on the Hot 100.
section: N/A

sentences: Machine Gun Kelly had his first starring role in the romantic drama Beyond the Lights (2014), and since appeared in the techno-thriller Nerve (2016), the horror Bird Box (2018), the comedy Big Time Adolescence and portrayed Tommy Lee in the biopic The Dirt (both 2019).

== Life and career == | === 1990–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Baker was born on April 22, 1990, in Houston to missionary parents.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Baker and his family moved all around the world and took up residence abroad from Egypt to Germany, as well as throughout the United States, in Chicago, Denver, and Cleveland.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He settled in Denver, along with his father, after his mother had left home, and the pair moved in with Baker's aunt.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Following his father suffering from depression and unemployment, Baker endured bullying from other children in the neighborhood.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He started listening to rap in the sixth grade, when he attended Hamilton Middle School, a school with an ethnically diverse student body in Denver.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: The first three rappers that got him into the genre of hip hop as a child were Ludacris, Eminem and DMX, with Baker gaining interest in the genre after listening to DMX's "We Right Here" from the album The Great Depression (2001).
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Following his father's departure, Baker stopped attending school and began to make a name for himself by calling out elder classmates.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In 2005, his father returned to take them both to Kuwait before the pair were forced back stateside to Cleveland, where Baker attended Shaker Heights High School.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In March 2009, while he was on the verge of getting evicted, Baker traveled to Harlem's Apollo Theater, where he had consecutive victories, making him the first ever rapper to win at the Apollo Theater.
section: == Life and career == | === 1990–2011: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: He recorded music in his home studio, which he refers to as the "Rage Cage", and started to gain exposure when he was featured on MTV2's Sucker Free Freestyle, where he freestyled numerous verses from his "Chip off the Block" single.

== Musical style and influences ==

sentences: Musical style and influences ==
section: == Musical style and influences ==

sentences: Baker's musical style has been mainly described as hip hop, pop-rap, and rap rock.
section: == Musical style and influences ==

sentences: His fifth album, Tickets to My Downfall, marked a change in sound and has been described as pop punk.
section: == Musical style and influences ==

sentences: Baker cites DMX and Eminem as music influences, as well as listening to rock bands Guns N' Roses and Blink-182 during his youth.
section: == Musical style and influences ==

sentences: Baker cites these rap and rock artists as major musical influences.
section: == Musical style and influences ==

sentences: In an interview discussing his collaboration with DMX, Baker called the rapper his idol.
section: == Musical style and influences ==

sentences: He also stated that DMX's music helped him through his troubles while growing up, especially bullying.
section: == Musical style and influences ==
== Acting career ==

sentences: Acting career ==
section: == Acting career ==

sentences: Baker made his film debut in the 2014 romantic drama Beyond the Lights, where he played a "shallow, self-important" rapper named Kid Culprit.
section: == Acting career ==

sentences: In 2016, he co-starred and co-executive produced the drama film The Land, a Cleveland-set drama produced by fellow rapper Nas.
section: == Acting career ==

sentences: The same year, he had a minor role in the techno-thriller adventure film Nerve with Emma Roberts and Dave Franco; and had a recurring role on the Showtime comedy-drama series Roadies as Wes, a former Pearl Jam roadie.
section: == Acting career ==

sentences: He played Felix in the 2018 Netflix post-apocalyptic horror thriller film Bird Box with Sandra Bullock, and portrayed drummer Tommy Lee in The Dirt, a 2019 Netflix biographical comedy-drama about Mötley Crüe.
section: == Acting career ==

sentences: He played the role of Newt in the 2020 superhero film Project Power opposite Jamie Foxx, and the following year, he co-starred with Bruce Willis and Megan Fox in the crime thriller film Midnight in the Switchgrass; and starred in the action western film The Last Son with Sam Worthington.
section: == Acting career ==

sentences: Personal life ==

sentences: Baker has a daughter, Casie Colson Baker,  born in July 2009.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: He is open about his use of cannabis and has claimed in many interviews that he smokes daily, describing it as a "source of happiness and a way people can feel a little more love [in their own right]".

sentences: He was also a heavy user of cocaine and alcohol prior to 2020.

sentences: In a 2012 interview, he stated that he identifies politically as an anarchist.

section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===
== Personal life == | === Feuds ===

sentences: Baker's feud with Eminem began on May 7, 2012, when he wrote a tweet saying that Eminem's daughter Hailie was "hot as fuck", despite her being sixteen at the time.
section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===

sentences: In an interview with WQHT on October 19, 2015, Baker alleged this led to Eminem blacklisting him from a number of radio stations.
section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===

sentences: On May 16, 2017, Baker performed a freestyle for KPWR, which featured a line referencing Eminem's supposed banning of him from Shade 45.
section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===

sentences: On March 1, 2018, Baker featured on a verse of Tech N9ne's song, "No Reason".
section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===

sentences: Shortly after, on August 31, 2018, Eminem released his diss track, "Not Alike" where he claimed that Baker's verse on the song was about him.
section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===

sentences: On September 3, 2018, Baker responded to this with his own diss track "Rap Devil".
section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===

sentences: On September 12, 2018, Eminem released an interview with Sway Calloway through his YouTube channel where he discussed his reason behind the feud.
section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===

sentences: On September 14, 2018, Eminem released "Killshot", in response to "Rap Devil".
section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===

sentences: On January 17, 2020, Eminem released the song "Unaccommodating", which featured a verse directed at Baker.
section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===

sentences: On March 17, 2020, Baker released the song "Bullets with Names", featuring Young Thug, RJMrLA and Lil Duke, which featured a verse directed at Eminem.
section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===

sentences: On December 18, 2020, Eminem released the song "Gnat".
section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===

sentences: In this song, Eminem dissed Baker in the chorus.
section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===

sentences: On December 15, 2021, Dr. Dre released a song titled "Gospel" featuring Eminem and The D.O.C. In this song, Eminem dissed Baker again.
section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===

sentences: Baker's feud with G-Eazy began after the end of G-Eazy's relationship with Halsey, when photographs of Baker and Halsey together surfaced.
section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===

sentences: On July 18, 2018, G-Eazy revealed that he had bleached his hair blond, which Baker alleged on Twitter was in an attempt to look like him.
section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===

sentences: On August 30, 2018, released G-Eazy diss track "Bad Boy" against Baker, who responded the next day in a freestyle performed for Hot 97.
section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===

sentences: The same day, Baker tweeted side-by-side photos of the two, with the caption "I fucked his girl now he looks like me this shit overbearing".
section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===

sentences: The two ended the feud in April 2019, through what NME described as an "intervention by Eminem".
section: == Personal life == | === Feuds ===
